intro: Lindernia grossidentata, commonly known as the broad-toothed lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Lindernia grossidentata is a perennial herb that is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
